issues.title: Missing Administrative Regulation for Civil and Legal Rights Implementation
issues.description: The Board Policy establishes employee civil and legal rights but lacks corresponding administrative regulation detailing implementation procedures. Key procedural elements missing include: complaint filing procedures for whistleblower retaliation, investigation processes, timeline requirements, appeal procedures, and specific steps for handling disclosures of improper governmental activity.

legal_citations.text: Requires districts to establish procedures for handling whistleblower complaints and investigations of retaliation claims

issues.required_language: Administrative regulation should include: (1) Specific procedures for filing whistleblower complaints, (2) Investigation timelines and processes, (3) Appeal procedures, (4) Documentation requirements, (5) Confidentiality protections, (6) Interim protective measures during investigations

issues.title: Missing Complaint Procedures Reference
issues.description: The policy references "district's complaint procedures" for whistleblower retaliation complaints but does not specify which complaint procedure applies or provide cross-reference to the applicable policy/regulation.

legal_citations.text: Requires clear procedures for employees to file complaints regarding retaliation for whistleblower activities

issues.required_language: Specific reference to applicable complaint procedure (e.g., "in accordance with BP/AR 4144 - Complaints" or establishment of specific whistleblower complaint procedure)

issues.title: Missing Whistleblower Hotline Display Requirements Implementation
issues.description: While the policy states the requirement to display whistleblower rights and hotline information, there are no implementation details regarding where, how, and who is responsible for maintaining these displays.

legal_citations.text: Requires prominent display in lettering larger than size 14 point type of employees' rights and responsibilities under whistleblower laws, including Attorney General hotline number

issues.required_language: Procedures specifying: (1) Locations for posting (employee break rooms, main offices, etc.), (2) Responsible party for posting and updating, (3) Format requirements, (4) Update schedule for hotline numbers

issues.title: Missing Cross-References to Related Policies
issues.description: The policy lacks cross-references to related policies that may impact employee civil rights, such as personnel evaluation, disciplinary procedures, or discrimination policies.

legal_citations.text: Comprehensive protection requires coordination with other personnel policies

issues.required_language: Cross-references to related policies such as: BP 4118 - Dismissal/Suspension/Disciplinary Action, BP 4030 - Nondiscrimination in Employment, BP 1312.3 - Uniform Complaint Procedures
